newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: C-C Amatil hit on Philippine peso woes.
newsitem.headline: C-C Amatil hit on Philippine peso woes.

text.p: Shares in beverage group Coca Cola Amatil Ltd were sold down further on Friday after taking a hammering 24 hours earlier. Brokers said the fresh falls are on the slump in the Philippines peso.

At 1.00 p.m. (0300 GMT), Coca Cola Amatil shares were 47 cents or 3.11 percent down at A$14.65 with 385,000 shares traded. A day earlier the group's shares fell seven percent on a downgrade by investment bank Merrill Lynch.
"I think it is a combination of the two (peso and downgrade), but I think people are wondering should they sell the stock further from here," one Sydney broker said.

C-C Amatil increased its exposure to the Philippines when it acquired San Miguel Corp soft-drink business, while the Philipines largest brewer received a 25 percent stake in C-C Amatil to become the group's second largest shareholder.
The Australian beverage group is 33 percent owned by The Coca-Cola Co. C-C Amatil shares have now fallen almost 16 percent since the beginning of July.
The Philippine peso tumbled over 11 percent earlier after the country's central bank announced it would allow the peso-dollar rate to move in a wider range.
